title: Linux whatis Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux whatis command, its purpose, syntax, and practical use cases. Learn how to effectively utilize this utility to quickly retrieve information about commands and system components.

meta.title: Linux whatis Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux whatis command, its purpose, syntax, and practical use cases. Learn how to effectively utilize this utility to quickly retrieve information about commands and system components.
meta.keywords: Linux, whatis, command, utility, manual, information, system, practical examples

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of whatis Command

verify.name: Verify whatis command usage
verify.hint: The `whatis` command should display a brief description for the `ls` command, indicating that it is used to list directory contents.

steps.title: Explore the Syntax and Options of whatis Command

verify.name: Verify whatis command options
verify.hint: The `whatis` command should display the expected output when using the `-a`, `-n`, and `-r` options.

steps.title: Demonstrate Practical Use Cases of whatis Command

verify.name: Verify whatis command usage for practical cases
verify.hint: The `whatis` command should display the expected output when used to find information about the `du` command, search for user-related commands, and check the manual section for the `passwd` command.
